sentence.Network_en: People said the aristocracy was effete.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们说贵族阶级已是日薄西山了.

sentence.Network_en: The absurd and backward - looking notion of locating a research centre in an effete , rundown, has - been country.
sentence.Network_cn: 把研究中心设在一个苍老 、 衰退 、 过了时的国家,纯属愚蠢,开倒车的想法.

sentence.Network_en: During the ages, Greek civilization declined and became effete.
sentence.Network_cn: 在中世纪期间, 希腊文明开始衰落直至衰败.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'no longer fertile, past bearing young'): from Latin effetus 'worn out by bearing young', from ex- 'out' + fetus 'breeding'; related to fetus

entry.tran: 软弱的;无权力的;怯懦的
entry.def: If you describe someone as effete, you are criticizing them for being weak and powerless.

example.ex: ...the charming but effete Russian gentry of the 1840s and 1850s.
example.tran: 19世纪四五十年代迷人但怯懦的俄国贵族

means.word_mean: 1. marked by excessive self-indulgence and moral decay;

sentences.sentence: "a decadent life of excessive money and no sense of responsibility"

auth_sentence.content: Nature...was as if effete now; could not any longer produce Great Men.
